terms.definition: Standard Operating Procedure - a detailed, written instruction document that describes the steps for performing a routine activity or process to ensure consistency and compliance.
A system that tracks and manages changes to documents or code over time, allowing users to see revision history and revert to previous versions if needed.
A centralized repository of information, documentation, and resources that provides searchable answers to questions and solutions to problems.
A collaborative feature that allows multiple people to simultaneously edit the same document in real-time, with changes visible to all users instantly.
A chronological record of all changes, modifications, and access to a document or system, used for tracking accountability and compliance purposes.
Contextual notes or feedback attached directly to specific sections of a document, allowing reviewers to provide targeted input without separate communication channels.
The process of organizing content in a hierarchical or logical format with headings, sections, and navigation elements for improved usability and findability.
Automatically generated condensed versions of longer documents created using artificial intelligence to extract and highlight key information.
Pre-designed document formats with standardized layouts, sections, and formatting that ensure consistency and completeness across similar document types.
Work groups composed of members from different departments or specialties who collaborate on projects requiring diverse expertise and perspectives.
The systematic monitoring and documentation of compliance requirements and changes in industry regulations to ensure organizational adherence.
A single, unified system where all team members can access, share, and collaborate on documents and information from one location.
Immediate synchronization of changes across all users and systems as modifications are made, ensuring everyone sees the most current information instantly.
A production methodology focused on minimizing waste and maximizing efficiency by eliminating non-value-added activities in manufacturing processes.
A cloud-based or software solution that enables organizations to create, manage, store, and collaborate on documents electronically rather than using paper-based systems.
